metadata.title: CVE-2019-13050 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description: Interaction between the sks-keyserver code through 1.2.0 of the SKSkeyserver network, and GnuPG through 2.2.16, makes it risky to have a GnuPGkeyserver configuration line referring to a host on the SKS keyservernetwork. Retrieving data from this network may cause a persistent denial ofservice, because of a Certificate Spamming Attack.

criterions.comment: sks: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
gnupg package in trusty/esm is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it (note: '2022-03-22').
